pregnancy_codes.explanation: Pregnancy-related codes can only be used for females of childbearing age

prostate_codes.description: Diseases of male genital organs - Prostate
prostate_codes.explanation: Prostate-related codes can only be used for males

testicular_codes.description: Other diseases of male genital organs
testicular_codes.explanation: Male genital organ codes can only be used for males

menopause_codes.explanation: Menopause-related codes are typically applicable to women age 35-65

menstruation_codes.explanation: Menstruation disorder codes can only be used for females of menstruating age

female_genital_codes.description: Inflammatory diseases of female pelvic organs
female_genital_codes.explanation: Female pelvic organ codes can only be used for females

ovarian_codes.description: Noninflammatory disorders of female genital tract
ovarian_codes.explanation: Female genital tract codes can only be used for females

breast_female_codes.explanation: Female breast disorder codes should typically be used for females (males can have breast conditions but less common)

pediatric_congenital.explanation: Congenital conditions are typically diagnosed in pediatric patients, though can persist into adulthood

senile_codes.explanation: These conditions typically occur in elderly patients

preventive_infant.explanation: This preventive code is specifically for infants under 1 year

preventive_early_childhood.explanation: This preventive code is specifically for children ages 1-4

preventive_late_childhood.explanation: This preventive code is specifically for children ages 5-11

preventive_adolescent.explanation: This preventive code is specifically for adolescents ages 12-17

preventive_young_adult.explanation: This preventive code is specifically for adults ages 18-39

preventive_middle_age.explanation: This preventive code is specifically for adults ages 40-64

preventive_senior.explanation: This preventive code is specifically for adults 65 and older

pediatric_exam.explanation: Child health examinations are for patients under 18

colonoscopy_screening.explanation: Screening colonoscopy is typically recommended starting at age 45

mammogram_screening.explanation: Screening mammograms are for women, typically starting at age 40

prostate_screening.explanation: Prostate screening is for men, typically starting at age 50

validation_priority.high: Age-specific code mismatch (e.g., pediatric code for adult)
validation_priority.medium: Atypical but possible (e.g., congenital condition in adult)

exemptions.transgender_considerations: Gender-specific anatomical codes may be valid for transgender patients. Use clinical judgment.
exemptions.age_ranges_flexible: Age ranges are guidelines; clinical documentation should support any deviations.
